name: Basketball
rules: Players score by shooting the ball through the opponent's hoop
Dribbling is required when moving with the ball
No physical contact that impedes opponent's movement
Shot clock: 24 seconds to attempt a shot
5 fouls per player before disqualification

positions.name: Point Guard
positions.role: Primary ball handler, sets up plays

positions.name: Small Forward
positions.role: Versatile player, inside and outside game

positions.name: Center
positions.role: Tallest player, dominates the paint, blocks shots

howToPlay: Basketball is played by two teams trying to score points by shooting a ball through a 10-foot high hoop. Teams advance the ball by dribbling or passing. The team with the most points at the end wins.

name: Soccer
rules: Players cannot use hands except goalkeeper in penalty area
Offside rule: attacker must have at least 2 opponents between them and goal
Free kicks awarded for fouls
Yellow card (warning), Red card (ejection)
Corner kicks when ball crosses goal line off defending team

positions.name: Goalkeeper
positions.role: Protects the goal, only player who can use hands

positions.name: Midfielder
positions.role: Links defense and attack, controls tempo

howToPlay: Two teams of 11 players each try to score by getting the ball into the opposing team's goal. Players move the ball primarily by kicking or heading it. The team with the most goals wins.

name: Tennis
rules: Ball must bounce once before being returned
Service alternates between players each game
Point scoring: 15, 30, 40, Game (must win by 2)
Sets won by first to 6 games (must win by 2)
Let serves (touching net on serve) are replayed
howToPlay: Players hit a ball over a net into the opponent's court. Points are scored when the opponent fails to return the ball within bounds. Players must win games, sets, and ultimately the match.

name: Cricket
duration: Varies: T20 (3 hours), ODI (8 hours), Test (5 days)
rules: Batting team scores runs by hitting ball and running between wickets
Bowling team tries to dismiss batsmen
10 ways to get out: bowled, caught, LBW, run out, etc.
Each team gets specific number of overs to bat
Six runs if ball crosses boundary without bouncing

positions.name: Batsman
positions.role: Scores runs by hitting the ball

positions.name: Bowler
positions.role: Delivers the ball to get batsman out

positions.name: Wicketkeeper
positions.role: Stands behind stumps, catches ball, attempts run-outs

howToPlay: Two teams take turns batting and fielding. The batting team tries to score runs while the fielding team tries to get them out. The team with the most runs wins.
